Could you please fix the `metro-2.0-license.txt`, too?

Results of `ant -Dcluster.config=full verify-libs-and-licenses`:
```
websvc.metro.lib/external/metro-2.0-license.txt has a GPL-family license but is either not covered by the Classpath Exception, or is not compile-time/optional only.
websvc.metro.lib/external/metro-2.0-license.txt contains a license body which does not match that in nbbuild/licenses/CDDL-GPL-2-CP: mismatch around: 'Contributor. means e' vs. '"Contributor" means '
```
https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/blob/d4d3e858f0303543fea08c00ed3c4358d7066e83/websvc.metro.lib/external/metro-2.0-license.txt#L1-L7

- We can remove the OSR line, maybe.
- `https://metro.dev.java.net/` is available no longer. Instead, this? https://javaee.github.io/metro/
- We cannot include GPL. So we have to choose CDDL-1.1 as "License" https://javaee.github.io/metro/LICENSE

Thanks.

`xml.xsd` seems to be from the W3C: https://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd

The file evolved in the last years and at the above url the current version can be found. As this file is authored by the w3c the w3c software license applies. Please have a look at `html.editor/licenseinfo.xml` and `html.editor/src/org/netbeans/modules/html/editor/resources/DTDs/xhtml/xhtml1-strict.dtd` which shows how the situation was handled in the past.

Basic idea:
- download the current version of the `xsl.xsd`
- replace the currently present version
- add W3C license header + Changes section
- add file to `licenseinfo.xml`

The Schema file is used at runtime for validation (it is accessible via the catalog).
If I'm not totally mistaken, all four files are templates that are used to generate client code. I would add a licenseinfo.xml, with comment type `TEMPLATE_MINIMAL_IP`.

Sorry, but this not nearly as easy. Please have a look at `libs.jaxb`. There XJC is included and I saw parts of the same code also in the metro jar.

It would be great if the binaries could be downloaded from maven central.

For the license: If I remember correctly the whole glassfish project (reference implementation of JavaEE) and this metro are GPLv2-CPE/CDDL1.1 (whether 1.0 or 1.1 is version dependend). For the apache netbeans project we would elect the CDDL.
Not much happened in the months prior to the initial code donation, so not much could have been lost.
I think that @tstupka should create a PR if possible because he is the author of the code.

Travis says:

BUILD FAILED
/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build.xml:1528: Failed VerifyLibsAndLicenses test(s):

-----------------------------------------------

You need to adjest references in the rat-exclutions.txt to any module of the cluster you moved. 

ex:
reference to css.editor module at line 182 and 183 of nbbuild/rat-exclusions.txt
css.editor/src/org/netbeans/modules/css/resources/CascadeStyleSheet.css.template
css.editor/src/org/netbeans/modules/css/resources/CssExample

------------------------

based on @matthiasblaesing s comment, 
please mind the types of referenced files and adjest the reference or move  to licenseinfo or maybe add appropriate licence headers to the files appropriately.

@thilina01 yes, thanks I will update them. What about:

BUILD FAILED
/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build.xml:1528: Failed VerifyLibsAndLicenses test(s):
Some binaries were found outside of <module>/external/ directories (edit nbbuild/antsrc/org/netbeans/nbbuild/extlibs/ignored-binaries as needed)
scratch/ide.etc/external/launchers-9.0.zip

Do you know how to fix this one?

Please do not use `rat-exclusions.txt`. That file neither gives information, nor does it survive relocations. If you adjust it, please use the `licenseinfo.xml` mechanism. Have a look at: `src/incubator-netbeans/languages.ini/licenseinfo.xml` which shows the case for:

- files that do not support comments
- files that are used as templates and offer only minimal ip
- files that are used in the GUI and adding a license would affect usability negatively

@matthiasblaesing  :) I was to ask that, by noticing those references. those kind of files may have been added earlier in licensing. and there may be more. 

What should be the best mechanism to clean up rat-exclusions.txt ?

@ralphbenjamin 
for the error you point, the first thing I would do is fix all the references in rat-exclusions.txt to see if it goes away.

I have not yet thought about that. Cases in `rat-exclusions.txt` that only affect only a few files are good candidates for moving to `licenseinfo.xml` and if `rat-exclusions.txt` is touched anyways, it would be good to cover it now.

The license of `websvc.core-external-resources.zip` is not correct and it would be better to include the files directly in the source.

- `sun-jaxws.xsd` already holds a valid license info
- The original version of `javaee_web_services_metadata_handler_2_0` can be found at
https://www.oracle.com/webfolder/technetwork/jsc/xml/ns/javaee/javaee_web_services_metadata_handler_2_0.xsd and carries also a valid header
- The same is true for the original version of `wsdl_customizationschema_2_0` from http://www.oracle.com/webfolder/technetwork/jsc/xml/ns/jaxws/wsdl_customizationschema_2_0.xsd

We elect the CDDL as the license under which we use the files (add a licenseinfo.xml for this). We can include the source according to (second last paragraph):
https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-b

This way the hole external binary can be dropped and we don't have to deal with the broken license.
Any reason not to merge this, looks great to me, I will wait 24 hours for objections, if there are none, I will merge this.
Everything seems to be good now, many thanks for the work here @ralphbenjamin and others! Is everything good here now and can we merge this?

Following steps taken to remove external folder
1. Remove external folder
2. Update build.xml file
3. Restore xsd file to "/src/org/netbeans/modules/websvc/core/resources" folder
4. Update license details in xsd file.

@jlahoda I'd like you to have a look at the changes in https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/807/commits/67eae767872521b15bd48cdfc7934d3ed0b8a05c and https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/807/commits/d52b9a3fe5008e8a89a9c141953365954f701451. I think you are most probably best suited to look into these.
Thanks for pointing me to that documentation.  I am going to close this pull request and re-do it using a branch.  I apologize for back and forth...I appreciate your time.

Hi Matthias,
https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/commit/67eae767872521b15bd48cdfc7934d3ed0b8a05c seems OK. For https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/commit/d52b9a3fe5008e8a89a9c141953365954f701451, there already is a mechanism where jar (in the built product) can specify that it is "in place" of a different jar/file (in external directory), and that its licensing info should be used. This is achieved by add "NB-Original-CRC: <crc>" attribute to the jar, please see c.jcraft.jsch/build.xml. Not sure if that is usable or useful here.

Thank you for the quick check. The point of https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/commit/d52b9a3fe5008e8a89a9c141953365954f701451 was not to copy license/notice (I'm aware of that mechanism), but being able to specify different license/notice. In the case of mojarra the base package contains apache licensed files and a notice file for included third party code, but we only use the TLD files to generate documentation from them. So I would argue the transitive dependencies don't hold true for the documentation package.

test-data can be excluded from the requirement for the ALv2 header if it clashes with the test itself. At some point we'll have to revisit the unittest again anyway and it was done at least for some of the XML unittests (I know because I did). If you don't want to update them, that is ok, please indicate so and I'll pull in only the licenseinfo.xml file, but it would be great if you could also look at the test files.

Great so far - I think the final nitpick: CDDL code needs reasoning to be included in ASF projects. Please see here:

https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/blob/dffa844eece9ffc49dd4073db043d0807cb6e50e/web.core/licenseinfo.xml#L90-L102

I faced the same situation as you did. CATEGORY-B here references to an explanation that give the reasoning required in [Apache Legal FAQ](https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-b) (second last paragraph)
Thank you!
